content.prompt: The plates of an isolated, charged parallel-plate capacitor are moved apart. Which of the following correctly indicates how the capacitance of the capacitor changes and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Decreases, because the amount of charge on the plates of the capacitor decreases.
Decreases, because the potential difference across the capacitor plates increases.
Does not change, because the area of the capacitor plates does not change.
Does not change, because the potential difference increases by the same factor as the distance between the plates increases.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
